files.description: Standalone Python script that loads the toy CSV, computes fixed/random pooled effects, writes a summary table, saves a forest plot into outputs, and appends a timestamped run log with produced file paths.
Runnable notebook version of the same workflow (load CSV, compute pooled effect, generate forest plot and summary table, and write a run log) for interactive demonstration.
Utility module implementing effect-size calculations, inverse-variance pooling (fixed/random), heterogeneity statistics, and plotting helpers used by both the script and notebook.
Placeholder file to ensure the outputs directory exists in version control for generated plots, tables, and logs.
Project documentation explaining how to run the script/notebook, required inputs, and where outputs (forest plot, summary table, run log) are written.
Pinned minimal Python dependencies needed to run the analysis script and notebook (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scipy).

missionDescription: Implement a minimal toy dataset (e.g., 5–10 rows) and an analysis script/notebook that (a) loads the CSV, (b) computes a simple pooled effect (fixed/random), (c) saves a forest plot and summary table into /outputs, and (d) writes a run log with timestamps and file paths.
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Forces an end-to-end, working meta-analysis pipeline (toy CSV -> saved pooled-estimate table + at least one figure + logs), directly satisfying the starter-kit ‘actually runs and outputs artifacts’ re...
